content: Who composed the four violin concertos known as "The Four Seasons", a group of four violin concerti each giving a musical expression to a season of the year?

The four violin concertos known as "The Four Seasons" were composed by Antonio Vivaldi, an Italian Baroque composer and violinist. These concerti are among his most famous works and were published in 1725 as part of a set of twelve concerti entitled "Il cimento dell'armonia e dell'inventione" (The Contest Between Harmony and Invention). Each concerto is named after a season: Spring, Summer, Autumn, and Winter, and they are accompanied by sonnets, possibly written by Vivaldi himself, which describe the scenes and emotions depicted in the music.
